endpoints.name: Search for images
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for images. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT. Free API accounts show results only from a limited library of media, not the full Shutterstock media library. Also, the number of search fields they can use in a request is limited.

query.name: library
query.description: Search within different Shutterstock owned libraries

query.name: added_date
query.description: Show images added on the specified date

query.name: added_date_start
query.description: Show images added on or after the specified date

query.name: aspect_ratio_min
query.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio or higher, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image

query.name: aspect_ratio_max
query.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio or lower, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image

query.name: aspect_ratio
query.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image

query.name: added_date_end
query.description: Show images added before the specified date

query.name: category
query.description: Show images with the specified Shutterstock-defined category; specify a category name or ID

query.name: color
query.description: Specify either a hexadecimal color in the format '4F21EA' or 'grayscale'; the API returns images that use similar colors

query.name: contributor
query.description: Show images with the specified contributor names or IDs, allows multiple

query.name: contributor_country
query.description: Show images from contributors in one or more specified countries, or start with NOT to exclude a country from the search

query.name: fields
query.description: Fields to display in the response; see the documentation for the fields parameter in the overview section

query.name: height
query.description: (Deprecated; use height_from and height_to instead) Show images with the specified height

query.name: height_from
query.description: Show images with the specified height or larger, in pixels

query.name: height_to
query.description: Show images with the specified height or smaller, in pixels

query.name: image_type
query.description: Show images of the specified type

query.name: keyword_safe_search
query.description: Hide results with potentially unsafe keywords

query.name: language
query.description: Set query and result language (uses Accept-Language header if not set)

query.name: license
query.description: Show only images with the specified license

query.name: model
query.description: Show image results with the specified model IDs

query.name: orientation
query.description: Show image results with horizontal or vertical orientation

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: people_model_released
query.description: Show images of people with a signed model release

query.name: people_age
query.description: Show images that feature people of the specified age category

query.name: people_ethnicity
query.description: Show images with people of the specified ethnicities, or start with NOT to show images without those ethnicities

query.name: people_gender
query.description: Show images with people of the specified gender

query.name: people_number
query.description: Show images with the specified number of people

query.name: query
query.description: One or more search terms separated by spaces; you can use NOT to filter out images that match a term

query.name: region
query.description: Raise or lower search result rankings based on the result's relevance to a specified region; you can provide a country code or an IP address from which the API infers a country

query.name: safe
query.description: Enable or disable safe search

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by

query.name: spellcheck_query
query.description: Spellcheck the search query and return results on suggested spellings

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

query.name: width
query.description: (Deprecated; use width_from and width_to instead) Show images with the specified width

query.name: width_from
query.description: Show images with the specified width or larger, in pixels

query.name: width_to
query.description: Show images with the specified width or smaller, in pixels

endpoints.name: Run multiple image searches
endpoints.description: This endpoint runs up to 5 image searches in a single request and returns up to 20 results per search. You can provide global search parameters in the query parameters and override them for each search in the body parameter. The query and body parameters are the same as in the `GET /v2/images/search` endpoint.

query.name: added_date
query.description: Show images added on the specified date

query.name: added_date_start
query.description: Show images added on or after the specified date

query.name: aspect_ratio_min
query.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio or higher, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image

query.name: aspect_ratio_max
query.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio or lower, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image

query.name: aspect_ratio
query.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image

query.name: added_date_end
query.description: Show images added before the specified date

query.name: category
query.description: Show images with the specified Shutterstock-defined category; specify a category name or ID

query.name: color
query.description: Specify either a hexadecimal color in the format '4F21EA' or 'grayscale'; the API returns images that use similar colors

query.name: contributor
query.description: Show images with the specified contributor names or IDs, allows multiple

query.name: contributor_country
query.description: Show images from contributors in one or more specified countries, or start with NOT to exclude a country from the search

query.name: fields
query.description: Fields to display in the response; see the documentation for the fields parameter in the overview section

query.name: height
query.description: (Deprecated; use height_from and height_to instead) Show images with the specified height

query.name: height_from
query.description: Show images with the specified height or larger, in pixels

query.name: height_to
query.description: Show images with the specified height or smaller, in pixels

query.name: image_type
query.description: Show images of the specified type

query.name: keyword_safe_search
query.description: Hide results with potentially unsafe keywords

query.name: language
query.description: Set query and result language (uses Accept-Language header if not set)

query.name: license
query.description: Show only images with the specified license

query.name: model
query.description: Show image results with the specified model IDs

query.name: orientation
query.description: Show image results with horizontal or vertical orientation

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: people_model_released
query.description: Show images of people with a signed model release

query.name: people_age
query.description: Show images that feature people of the specified age category

query.name: people_ethnicity
query.description: Show images with people of the specified ethnicities, or start with NOT to show images without those ethnicities

query.name: people_gender
query.description: Show images with people of the specified gender

query.name: people_number
query.description: Show images with the specified number of people

query.name: region
query.description: Raise or lower search result rankings based on the result's relevance to a specified region; you can provide a country code or an IP address from which the API infers a country

query.name: safe
query.description: Enable or disable safe search

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by

query.name: spellcheck_query
query.description: Spellcheck the search query and return results on suggested spellings

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

query.name: width
query.description: (Deprecated; use width_from and width_to instead) Show images with the specified width

query.name: width_from
query.description: Show images with the specified width or larger, in pixels

query.name: width_to
query.description: Show images with the specified width or smaller, in pixels

[
    {

        "color": "<string>",

            "<string>"
        ],

            "<country-code-2>",
            "<country-code-2>"
        ],
        "fields": "<string>",
        "height": "<integer>",
        "height_from": "<integer>",
        "height_to": "<integer>",
        "image_type": [
            "<string>",

        ],
        "keyword_safe_search": true,
        "language": "<string>",
        "license": [
            "commercial"
        ],
        "model": [
            "<string>",
            "<string>"
        ],
        "orientation": "<string>",
        "page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "people_model_released": "<boolean>",
        "people_age": "<string>",
        "people_ethnicity": [
            "<string>",
            "<string>"
        ],
        "people_gender": "<string>",
        "people_number": "<integer>",
        "query": "<string>",
        "region": "<country-code-2>",
        "safe": true,
        "sort": "popular",
        "spellcheck_query": true,
        "view": "minimal",
        "width": "<integer>",
        "width_from": "<integer>",
        "width_to": "<integer>"
    },
    {
        "added_date": "<date>",
        "added_date_start": "<date>",
        "aspect_ratio_min": "<number>",
        "aspect_ratio_max": "<number>",
        "aspect_ratio": "<number>",
        "added_date_end": "<date>",
        "authentic": "<boolean>",
        "category": "<string>",
        "color": "<string>",
        "contributor": [
            "<string>",
            "<string>"
        ],
        "contributor_country": [
            "<country-code-2>",
            "<country-code-2>"
        ],
        "fields": "<string>",
        "height": "<integer>",
        "height_from": "<integer>",
        "height_to": "<integer>",
        "image_type": [
            "<string>",
            "<string>"
        ],
        "keyword_safe_search": true,
        "language": "<string>",
        "license": [
            "commercial"
        ],
        "model": [
            "<string>",
            "<string>"
        ],
        "orientation": "<string>",
        "page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "people_model_released": "<boolean>",
        "people_age": "<string>",
        "people_ethnicity": [
            "<string>",
            "<string>"
        ],
        "people_gender": "<string>",
        "people_number": "<integer>",
        "query": "<string>",
        "region": "<country-code-2>",
        "safe": true,
        "sort": "popular",
        "spellcheck_query": true,
        "view": "minimal",
        "width": "<integer>",
        "width_from": "<integer>",
        "width_to": "<integer>"
    }
]

endpoints.name: Get suggestions for a search term
endpoints.description: This endpoint provides autocomplete suggestions for partial search terms.

query.name: query
query.description: (Required) Search term for which you want keyword suggestions

query.name: limit
query.description: Limit the number of suggestions

endpoints.name: Get keywords from text
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns up to 10 important keywords from a block of plain text.

endpoints.name: List image categories
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists the categories (Shutterstock-assigned genres) that images can belong to.

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

endpoints.name: List similar images
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns images that are visually similar to an image that you specify.

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

endpoints.name: List recommended images
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns images that customers put in the same collection as the specified image IDs.

query.name: id
query.description: (Required) Image IDs

query.name: max_items
query.description: Maximum number of results returned in the response

query.name: safe
query.description: Restrict results to safe images

endpoints.name: List updated images
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists images that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the `interval` parameter to show images that were updated recently, but you can also use the `start_date` and `end_date` parameters to specify a range of no more than three days. Do not use the `interval` parameter with either `start_date` or `end_date`.

query.name: type
query.description: Show images that were added, deleted, or edited; by default, the endpoint returns images that were updated in any of these ways

query.name: start_date
query.description: Show images updated on or after the specified date. The API will default to UTC (00:00:00) if no specific time is provided, ensuring consistency.

query.name: end_date
query.description: Show images updated before the specified date. The API will default to UTC (00:00:00) if no specific time is provided, ensuring consistency. Please note that the end date must be at least 5 minutes after the start date.

query.name: interval
query.description: Show images updated in the specified time period, where the time period is an interval (like SQL INTERVAL) such as 1 DAY, 6 HOUR, or 30 MINUTE; the default is 1 HOUR, which shows images that were updated in the hour preceding the request

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

endpoints.name: List images
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists information about one or more images, including the available sizes.

query.name: id
query.description: (Required) One or more image IDs

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

query.name: search_id
query.description: The ID of the search that is related to this request

endpoints.name: Get details about images
endpoints.description: This endpoint shows information about an image, including a URL to a preview image and the sizes that it is available in.

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

query.name: search_id
query.description: The ID of the search that is related to this request

endpoints.name: License images
endpoints.description: This endpoint gets licenses for one or more images. You must specify the image IDs in the body parameter and other details like the format, size, and subscription ID either in the query parameter or with each image ID in the body parameter. Values in the body parameter override values in the query parameters. The download links in the response are valid for 8 hours.

query.name: subscription_id
query.description: Subscription ID to use to license the image

query.name: format
query.description: (Deprecated) Image format

query.name: size
query.description: Image size

query.name: search_id
query.description: Search ID that was provided in the results of an image search

endpoints.name: List image licenses
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists existing licenses.

query.name: image_id
query.description: Show licenses for the specified image ID

query.name: license
query.description: Show images that are available with the specified license, such as `standard` or `enhanced`

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

query.name: username
query.description: Filter licenses by username of licensee

query.name: start_date
query.description: Show licenses created on or after the specified date

query.name: end_date
query.description: Show licenses created before the specified date

query.name: download_availability
query.description: Filter licenses by download availability

query.name: team_history
query.description: Set to true to see license history for all members of your team.

endpoints.name: Download images
endpoints.description: This endpoint redownloads images that you have already received a license for. The download links in the response are valid for 8 hours.

endpoints.name: Create image collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint creates one or more image collections (lightboxes). To add images to the collections, use `POST /v2/images/collections/{id}/items`.

endpoints.name: List image collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists your collections of images and their basic attributes.

query.name: embed
query.description: Which sharing information to include in the response, such as a URL to the collection

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

endpoints.name: Get the details of image collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint gets more detailed information about a collection, including its cover image and timestamps for its creation and most recent update. To get the images in collections, use `GET /v2/images/collections/{id}/items`.

query.name: embed
query.description: Which sharing information to include in the response, such as a URL to the collection

query.name: share_code
query.description: Code to retrieve a shared collection

endpoints.name: Rename image collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint sets a new name for an image collection.

endpoints.name: Delete image collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint deletes an image collection.

endpoints.name: Add images to collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint adds one or more images to a collection by image IDs.

endpoints.name: Get the contents of image collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists the IDs of images in a collection and the date that each was added.

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: share_code
query.description: Code to retrieve the contents of a shared collection

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

endpoints.name: Remove images from collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint removes one or more images from a collection.

query.name: item_id
query.description: One or more image IDs to remove from the collection

endpoints.name: Search for videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for videos. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.

query.name: added_date
query.description: Show videos added on the specified date

query.name: added_date_start
query.description: Show videos added on or after the specified date

query.name: added_date_end
query.description: Show videos added before the specified date

query.name: aspect_ratio
query.description: Show videos with the specified aspect ratio

query.name: category
query.description: Show videos with the specified Shutterstock-defined category; specify a category name or ID

query.name: contributor
query.description: Show videos with the specified artist names or IDs

query.name: contributor_country
query.description: Show videos from contributors in one or more specified countries

query.name: duration
query.description: (Deprecated; use duration_from and duration_to instead) Show videos with the specified duration in seconds

query.name: duration_from
query.description: Show videos with the specified duration or longer in seconds

query.name: duration_to
query.description: Show videos with the specified duration or shorter in seconds

query.name: fps
query.description: (Deprecated; use fps_from and fps_to instead) Show videos with the specified frames per second

query.name: fps_from
query.description: Show videos with the specified frames per second or more

query.name: fps_to
query.description: Show videos with the specified frames per second or fewer

query.name: keyword_safe_search
query.description: Hide results with potentially unsafe keywords

query.name: language
query.description: Set query and result language (uses Accept-Language header if not set)

query.name: license
query.description: Show only videos with the specified license or licenses

query.name: model
query.description: Show videos with each of the specified models

query.name: orientation
query.description: Search for videos in a specific orientation

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: people_age
query.description: Show videos that feature people of the specified age range

query.name: people_ethnicity
query.description: Show videos with people of the specified ethnicities

query.name: people_gender
query.description: Show videos with people with the specified gender

query.name: people_number
query.description: Show videos with the specified number of people

query.name: people_model_released
query.description: Show only videos of people with a signed model release

query.name: query
query.description: One or more search terms separated by spaces; you can use NOT to filter out videos that match a term

query.name: resolution
query.description: Show videos with the specified resolution

query.name: safe
query.description: Enable or disable safe search

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by one of these categories

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

endpoints.name: Get suggestions for a search term
endpoints.description: This endpoint provides autocomplete suggestions for partial search terms.

query.name: query
query.description: (Required) Search term for which you want keyword suggestions

query.name: limit
query.description: Limit the number of the suggestions

endpoints.name: List similar videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for videos that are similar to a video that you specify.

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

endpoints.name: List updated videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists videos that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the `interval` parameter to show videos that were updated recently, but you can also use the `start_date` and `end_date` parameters to specify a range of no more than three days. Do not use the `interval` parameter with either `start_date` or `end_date`.

query.name: start_date
query.description: Show videos updated on or after the specified date. The API will default to UTC (00:00:00) if no specific time is provided, ensuring consistency.

query.name: end_date
query.description: Show videos updated before the specified date. The API will default to UTC (00:00:00) if no specific time is provided, ensuring consistency. Please note that the end date must be at least 5 minutes after the start date.

query.name: interval
query.description: Show videos updated in the specified time period, where the time period is an interval (like SQL INTERVAL) such as 1 DAY, 6 HOUR, or 30 MINUTE; the default is 1 HOUR, which shows videos that were updated in the hour preceding the request

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by oldest or newest videos first

endpoints.name: List videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists information about one or more videos, including the aspect ratio and URLs to previews.

query.name: id
query.description: (Required) One or more video IDs

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

query.name: search_id
query.description: The ID of the search that is related to this request

endpoints.name: Get details about videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint shows information about a video, including URLs to previews and the sizes that it is available in.

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

query.name: search_id
query.description: The ID of the search that is related to this request

endpoints.name: List video categories
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists the categories (Shutterstock-assigned genres) that videos can belong to.

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

endpoints.name: License videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint gets licenses for one or more videos. You must specify the video IDs in the body parameter and the size and subscription ID either in the query parameter or with each video ID in the body parameter. Values in the body parameter override values in the query parameters. The download links in the response are valid for 8 hours.

query.name: subscription_id
query.description: The subscription ID to use for licensing

query.name: size
query.description: The size of the video to license

query.name: search_id
query.description: The Search ID that led to this licensing event

endpoints.name: List video licenses
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists existing licenses.

query.name: video_id
query.description: Show licenses for the specified video ID

query.name: license
query.description: Show videos that are available with the specified license, such as `standard` or `enhanced`

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by oldest or newest videos first

query.name: username
query.description: Filter licenses by username of licensee

query.name: start_date
query.description: Show licenses created on or after the specified date

query.name: end_date
query.description: Show licenses created before the specified date

query.name: download_availability
query.description: Filter licenses by download availability

query.name: team_history
query.description: Set to true to see license history for all members of your team.

endpoints.name: Download videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint redownloads videos that you have already received a license for.

endpoints.name: Create video collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint creates one or more collections (clipboxes). To add videos to collections, use `POST /v2/videos/collections/{id}/items`.

endpoints.name: List video collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists your collections of videos and their basic attributes.

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: embed
query.description: Which sharing information to include in the response, such as a URL to the collection

endpoints.name: Get the details of video collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint gets more detailed information about a collection, including the timestamp for its creation and the number of videos in it. To get the videos in collections, use GET /v2/videos/collections/{id}/items.

query.name: embed
query.description: Which sharing information to include in the response, such as a URL to the collection

query.name: share_code
query.description: Code to retrieve a shared collection

endpoints.name: Rename video collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint sets a new name for a collection.

endpoints.name: Delete video collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint deletes a collection.

endpoints.name: Add videos to collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint adds one or more videos to a collection by video IDs.

endpoints.name: Get the contents of video collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists the IDs of videos in a collection and the date that each was added.

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: share_code
query.description: Code to retrieve the contents of a shared collection

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

endpoints.name: Remove videos from collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint removes one or more videos from a collection.

query.name: item_id
query.description: One or more video IDs to remove from the collection

endpoints.name: Search for tracks
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for tracks. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter.

query.name: artists
query.description: Show tracks with one of the specified artist names or IDs

query.name: bpm
query.description: (Deprecated; use bpm_from and bpm_to instead) Show tracks with the specified beats per minute

query.name: bpm_from
query.description: Show tracks with the specified beats per minute or faster

query.name: bpm_to
query.description: Show tracks with the specified beats per minute or slower

query.name: duration
query.description: Show tracks with the specified duration in seconds

query.name: duration_from
query.description: Show tracks with the specified duration or longer in seconds

query.name: duration_to
query.description: Show tracks with the specified duration or shorter in seconds

query.name: genre
query.description: Show tracks with each of the specified genres; to get the list of genres, use `GET /v2/audio/genres`

query.name: is_instrumental
query.description: Show instrumental music only

query.name: instruments
query.description: Show tracks with each of the specified instruments; to get the list of instruments, use `GET /v2/audio/instruments`

query.name: moods
query.description: Show tracks with each of the specified moods; to get the list of moods, use `GET /v2/audio/moods`

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: search_id

query.description: Show licenses for the specified track ID

query.name: license
query.description: Restrict results by license.

query.description: Page number

query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: download_availability

query.name: team_history

endpoints.name: Download audio tracks

endpoints.name: Create audio collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint creates one or more collections (soundboxes). To add tracks, use `POST /v2/audio/collections/{id}/items`.

endpoints.description: This endpoint lists your collections of audio tracks and their basic attributes.

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: embed
query.description: Which sharing information to include in the response, such as a URL to the collection

endpoints.description: This endpoint gets more detailed information about a collection, including the number of items in it and when it was last updated. To get the tracks in collections, use `GET /v2/audio/collections/{id}/items`.

query.name: embed
query.description: Which sharing information to include in the response, such as a URL to the collection

query.name: share_code

endpoints.description: This endpoint adds one or more tracks to a collection by track IDs.

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

endpoints.name: Remove audio tracks from collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint removes one or more tracks from a collection.

query.description: One or more item IDs to remove from the collection

endpoints.name: Search for sound effects
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for sound effects. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition.

query.name: added_date_end

query.name: duration_to

query.name: search_id

query.description: Show licenses for the specified sound effects ID

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page

query.name: sort

query.name: username
query.description: Filter licenses by username of licensee

query.name: download_availability

query.name: team_history
query.description: Set to true to see license history for all members of your team.

endpoints.name: License sound effects
endpoints.description: This endpoint licenses sounds effect assets.

endpoints.name: Download sound effects
endpoints.description: This endpoint redownloads sound effects that you have already received a license for. The download links in the response are valid for 8 hours.

endpoints.name: Search editorial images
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for editorial images. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. For example, if you set the `category` parameter to "Alone,Performing" and also specify a `query` parameter, the results include only images that match the query and are in both the Alone and Performing categories. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.

query.name: query
query.description: One or more search terms separated by spaces

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by

query.name: category
query.description: Show editorial content with each of the specified editorial categories; specify category names in a comma-separated list

query.name: country
query.description: (Required) Show only editorial content that is available for distribution in a certain country

query.name: supplier_code
query.description: Show only editorial content from certain suppliers

query.name: date_start
query.description: Show only editorial content generated on or after a specific date

query.name: date_end
query.description: Show only editorial content generated on or before a specific date

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: cursor
query.description: The cursor of the page with which to start fetching results; this cursor is returned from previous requests

endpoints.name: List updated content
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists editorial images that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the date_updated_start and date_updated_end parameters to specify a range updates based on when the updates happened. You can also use the date_taken_start and date_taken_end parameters to specify a range of updates based on when the image was taken.

query.name: type
query.description: (Required) Specify `addition` to return only images that were added or `edit` to return only images that were edited or deleted

query.name: date_updated_start
query.description: (Required) Show images images added, edited, or deleted after the specified date. Acceptable range is 1970-01-01T00:00:01 to 2038-01-19T00:00:00.

query.name: date_updated_end
query.description: (Required) Show images images added, edited, or deleted before the specified date. Acceptable range is 1970-01-01T00:00:01 to 2038-01-19T00:00:00.

query.name: date_taken_start
query.description: Show images that were taken on or after the specified date; use this parameter if you want recently created images from the collection instead of updated older assets

query.name: date_taken_end
query.description: Show images that were taken before the specified date

query.name: cursor
query.description: The cursor of the page with which to start fetching results; this cursor is returned from previous requests

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by

query.name: supplier_code
query.description: Show only editorial content from certain suppliers

query.name: country
query.description: (Required) Show only editorial content that is available for distribution in a certain country

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

endpoints.name: List editorial categories
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists the categories that editorial images can belong to, which are separate from the categories that other types of assets can belong to.

endpoints.name: Get editorial content details
endpoints.description: This endpoint shows information about an editorial image, including a URL to a preview image and the sizes that it is available in.

query.name: country
query.description: (Required) Returns only if the content is available for distribution in a certain country

query.name: country
query.description: (Required) Show only editorial image content that is available for distribution in a certain country

query.name: search_id

query.name: team_history

query.name: country

query.name: country

You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.

endpoints.name: License editorial video content
endpoints.description: This endpoint gets licenses for one or more editorial videos. You must specify the country and one or more editorial videos to license. The download links in the response are valid for 8 hours.

endpoints.name: Upload images
endpoints.description: This endpoint uploads an image for reverse image or video search. Images must be in JPEG or PNG format. To get the search results, pass the upload ID that this endpoint returns to the GET /v2/cv/similar/images or GET /v2/cv/similar/videos endpoints. Contact us for access to this endpoint.

endpoints.name: List similar images
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns images that are visually similar to an image that you specify or upload.

query.name: asset_id
query.description: (Required) The asset ID or upload ID to find similar images for

query.name: license
query.description: Show only images with the specified license

query.name: safe
query.description: Enable or disable safe search

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

endpoints.name: List similar videos
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns videos that are visually similar to an image that you specify or upload.

query.name: asset_id
query.description: (Required) The asset ID or upload ID to find similar videos for

query.name: license
query.description: Show only videos with the specified license

query.name: safe
query.description: Enable or disable safe search

query.name: language
query.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: view
query.description: Amount of detail to render in the response

endpoints.name: List suggested keywords
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns a list of suggested keywords for a media item that you specify or upload.

query.name: asset_id
query.description: (Required) The asset ID or upload ID to suggest keywords for

endpoints.name: Search catalogs for assets
endpoints.description: This endpoint searches for assets in the account's catalog. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: query
query.description: One or more search terms separated by spaces

query.name: collection_id
query.description: Filter by collection id

query.name: asset_type
query.description: Filter by asset type

endpoints.name: List catalog collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns a list of catalog collections.

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort by

query.name: shared
query.description: Set to true to omit collections that you own and return only collections  that are shared with you

endpoints.name: Create catalog collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint creates a catalog collection and optionally adds assets. To add assets to the collection later, use `PATCH /v2/catalog/collections/{collection_id}/items`.

endpoints.name: Update collection metadata
endpoints.description: This endpoint updates the metadata of a catalog collection.

endpoints.name: Delete catalog collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint deletes a catalog collection. It does not remove the assets from the user's account's catalog.

endpoints.name: Add items to catalog collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint adds assets to a catalog collection. It also automatically adds the assets to the user's account's catalog.

endpoints.name: Remove items from catalog collection
endpoints.description: This endpoint removes assets from a catalog collection. It does not remove the assets from the user's account's catalog.

endpoints.name: Get details about multiple contributors
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists information about one or more contributors, including contributor type, equipment they use and other attributes.

query.name: id
query.description: (Required) One or more contributor IDs

endpoints.name: Get details about a single contributor
endpoints.description: This endpoint shows information about a single contributor, including contributor type, equipment they use, and other attributes.

endpoints.name: List contributors' collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists collections based on contributor ID.

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

endpoints.name: Get details about contributors' collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint gets more detailed information about a contributor's collection, including its cover image, timestamps for its creation, and most recent update. To get the items in collections, use GET /v2/contributors/{contributor_id}/collections/{id}/items.

endpoints.name: Get the items in contributors' collections
endpoints.description: This endpoint lists the IDs of items in a contributor's collection and the date that each was added.

query.name: page
query.description: Page number

query.name: per_page
query.description: Number of results per page

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort order

query.name: text
query.description: Text to echo

query.name: id
query.description: (Required) Integer ID

query.name: tag
query.description: List of tags

endpoints.name: Authorize applications
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns a redirect URI (in the 'Location' header) that the customer uses to authorize your application and, together with POST /v2/oauth/access_token, generate an access token that represents that authorization.

query.name: client_id
query.description: (Required) Client ID (Consumer Key) of your application

query.name: realm
query.description: User type to be authorized (usually 'customer')

query.name: redirect_uri
query.description: (Required) The callback URI to send the request to after authorization; must use a host name that is registered with your application

query.name: response_type
query.description: (Required) Type of temporary authorization code that will be used to generate an access code; the only valid value is 'code'

query.name: scope
query.description: Space-separated list of scopes to be authorized

query.name: state
query.description: (Required) Unique value used by the calling app to verify the request

endpoints.name: Get access tokens
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns an access token for the specified user and with the specified scopes. The token does not expire until the user changes their password. The body parameters must be encoded as form data.

fields.name: client_id
fields.description: (Required) Client ID (Consumer Key) of your application

fields.name: grant_type
fields.description: (Required) Grant type: authorization_code generates user tokens, client_credentials generates short-lived client grants

fields.name: client_secret
fields.description: Client Secret (Consumer Secret) of your application

fields.name: code
fields.description: Response code from the /oauth/authorize flow; required if grant_type=authorization_code

fields.name: expires
fields.description: Whether or not the token expires, expiring tokens come with a refresh_token to renew the access_token

fields.name: refresh_token
fields.description: Pass this along with grant_type=refresh_token to get a fresh access token

metadata.description:
# Getting Started

The Shutterstock API provides access to Shutterstock's library of media, as well as information about customers' accounts and the contributors that provide the media. It allows customer platforms to search for media, view information and previews for the media, and license and download media.

1. Create an application at [https://www.shutterstock.com/account/developers/apps](https://www.shutterstock.com/account/developers/apps). To license media, you also need a paid subscription, but the API provides a free option for you to try out the API without licensing media. For information about applications and subscriptions, see [Subscriptions](https://api-reference.shutterstock.com/#subscriptions) in the API reference.
1. Authenticate to the API to get a token. You can get a token from the application page, or you can use the methods described in [Authentication](https://api-reference.shutterstock.com/#authentication) in the API reference.

Now you're ready to make your first API request.

## Basic API requests

Let's search Shutterstock's catalog of images:

1. In the Postman **Collections** tab, open the Shutterstock API collection dropdown.
1. In the collection, click **Images** > **Search** > **Search for images**. This request uses the API `GET /v2/images/search` endpoint.
1. Click the **Authorization** tab of the request.
1. In the **Type** dropdown, select **OAuth 2.0**.
1. Enter your Shutterstock access token in the **Access Token** box.
1. Click the **Params** tab of the request.
1. In the `query` parameter, type a search term, such as "flowers."
1. Click **Send**.

The API response contains 20 images, including URLs to thumbnails. To customize your search, check out the full list of parameters on the `GET /v2/images/search` endpoint.

## Other resources

For full documentation, check out our [api-reference](https://api-reference.shutterstock.com/#overview).

To learn more about all of the services that we offer to developers, head over to our [developer portal](https://www.shutterstock.com/developers).
